conclusion: To determine whether the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is greater than 75 meters or less than 75 meters, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph provided.
The graph shows the vertical velocity v of the skydiver in meters per second (m/s) over time t in seconds.
At t = 0 seconds, the velocity is v = 20 m/s.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is v = 10 m/s.
At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is v = 0 m/s.

premise: The distance fallen during this interval can be calculated using the formula: Distance = ∫(t1 to t2) v(t) dt. Here, t1 = 10 seconds and t2 = 15 seconds.
conclusion: Substituting the values: Distance = ∫(10 to 15) 10 dt = 10 ∫(10 to 15) dt = 10 × (15 - 10) = 10 × 5 = 50 meters
The given condition is that the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is greater than 75 meters.

premise: Since 50 meters is less than 75 meters, the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is less than 75 meters.
